# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's the Julia function to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase it
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```
This function can be used to clean a column name as follows:

```julia
column_name = " My Column "
cleaned_column_name = clean_column(column_name)
println("Cleaned Column Name is : ", cleaned_column_name) # Outputs: Cleaned Column Name is : my_column
```
